greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the square root of the golden ratio.
comment: The hyperbolas x^2 - y^2 = 1 and xy = 1 meet at (c, 1/c) and (-c, -1/c), where c = sqrt(golden ratio); see the Mathematica program for a graph. - _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 19 2011
An algebraic integer of degree 4. Minimal polynomial: x^4 - x^2 - 1. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 07 2013

Also the the limiting value of the ratio of the slopes of the tangents drawn to the function y=sqrt(x) from the abscissa F(n) points (where F(n)=A000045(n) are the Fibonacci numbers and n > 0). - _Burak Muslu_, Apr 04 2021
reference: B, Muslu, Sayılar ve Bağlantılar 2, Luna, 2021, pages 45-48.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Mohammad K. Azarian, Problem 123, Missouri Journal of Mathematical Sciences, Vol. 10, No. 3, Fall 1998, p. 176. Solution published in Vol. 12, No. 1, Winter 2000, pp. 61-62.
xref: Cf. A001622, A094214, A104457, A098317, A002390; A197762 (related intersection of hyperbolas).
results.author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Apr 14 2008
